intro: Epigynium serratum, commonly known as the serrated epigynium, is a rare flowering plant characterized by its unique floral structure. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is known for its compound umbels of small, white to pale yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. Its leaves are finely divided and have a fern-like appearance, contributing to its ornamental value. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a vulnerable species in many regions.
